Product.Product_Name: Last Child in the Woods: Saving our Children from Nature-Deficit Disorder - 2nd Edition
Product.Long_Description: This second edition of Richard Louv's Last Child in the Woods will change the way you think about your children's connection with the natural world. Author: Richard Louv. Softcover; 334 pages. Published by Algonquin Books of Chapel Hill; copyright 2008. Second edition includes a field guide with 100 practical actions we can take, updated research and 35 discussion points for classrooms and communities. Also includes a progress report by Richard Louv.
Product.Short_Description: This second edition of Richard Louv's Last Child in the Woods will change the way you think about your children's connection with the natural world.

Product.Long_Description: Whether you're a commuter or a metropolitan day-tripper, this detailed map of the Denver area will show you the best routes to ride. Highlighted routes show primary, secondary and on-street bike paths. Detailed inset shows the downtown core; map margins provide rules of the road, safety precautions and other useful information. Double-sided map measures 34 x 22 in., and folds to 9 x 4 in. Scale: 1.125 in. equals one mile. Mapsco Maps; copyright 2008.
Product.Short_Description: Whether you're a commuter or a metropolitan day-tripper, this detailed map of the Denver area will show you the best routes to ride.

Product.Long_Description: This waterproof river guide chronicles the Green River from Labyrinth Canyon to Lees Ferry on the Colorado River. Design and cartography: Buzz Belknap; text: Loie Belknap Evans; geology text: R. J. Johnson. Softcover; 79 pages; color maps, illustrations and photographs. Westwater Books; copyright 2008. Guide covers the following areas: Labyrinth/Stillwater, Horsethief/Ruby, Westwater/Moab, Moab/Confluence, Cataract Canyon, Lake Powell and Glen Canyon. Detailed river maps note river miles, campsites, put-ins/take-outs, history/geology notes and other important paddling information. Special section details the fascinating geology and history of the area. An excellent companion on the water; simply blot and separate pages to dry.
Product.Short_Description: This waterproof river guide chronicles the Green River from Labyrinth Canyon to Lees Ferry on the Colorado River.

Product.Long_Description: Learn how to plan and prepare for a backpacking trip from expert William Kemsley Jr., founder of. Author: William Kemsley Jr. Softcover; 304 pages; color photographs; black-and-white illustrations. Stackpole Books; copyright 2008. Learn must-know trail skills: finding your way, purifying water, cooking on the trail, where and when to set up camp. Covers solo backpacking, all-female groups, hiking with children, seniors and pets, and ideas for going light and enhancing your trail photography. Read about how to handle dangerous situations-encounters with bears, inclement weather and medical emergencies.
Product.Short_Description: Learn how to plan and prepare for a backpacking trip from expert William Kemsley Jr., founder of Backpacker magazine.

Product.Long_Description: Revised and updated, this new edition contains cycling routes that range from 4 to 114 miles in length. Author: Andi Marie Cantele. Softcover; 214 pages; black-and-white photographs and maps. The Countryman Press; copyright 2007. Overview chart provides at-a-glance info for each tour, including distance, difficulty, suggested type of bike, kid-friendliness and ride highlights. Each chapter includes a map and information on mileage, terrain and detailed route descriptions. Fascinating commentary on the history and culture of Connecticut is woven throughout the chapters.
Product.Short_Description: Revised and updated, this new edition contains cycling routes that range from 4 to 114 miles in length.
